Package beans.crawler

Class SimpleCrawler

  • java.lang.Object
    • beans.crawler.SimpleCrawler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Crawler
    public class SimpleCrawler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Crawler
    This class is a simple implementation of the Crawler interface. Implements all basic methods of Crawler interface for present an example of the simple crawling process.

    To crawl pages, the class object must be provided with an implementation: LinkManager - controls the process of scanning web pages: connecting, downloading, saving the result of scanning

    StatisticManager - controls the process of collecting statistics from downloaded pages

    To get a class object use class builder CrawlerBuilder

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Verbitsky Sergey
    See Also:
    LinkManager, StatisticManager, CrawlerBuilder, DefaultCrawlerSettings

      Stores number of page limit for scanning

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleCrawler

        public SimpleCrawler​(java.lang.String seedUrl,
                     int pageLimit,
                     int depthLinkLimit,
                     boolean parallelMode,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> searchWords)
        Construct a simple crawler object
        Parameters:
        depthLinkLimit - - sets the depth of visited pages. Link depth is the number of clicks required to reach a given page from the home page
        pageLimit - - sets the count of scanning pages
        parallelMode - - sets the use of multithreading when scanning pages. Value "true" - multithreading is enable (uses the number of threads specified in DefaultCrawlerSettings Value "false" - using one thread.

        Note: When using multithreaded mode, the scan threads may take some time to shut down

        This param does not affect the use of multithreading by statistics manager. Statistic manager use LinkManager always starts in a separate thread.

        searchWords - - contains a list if searching words
        seedUrl - - sets the start page for scanning
